Posts.Content: May 22, 2013 02:53PM Pocoglow wrote: Thank you Ultrarunner, Deb and ICanDoThis for you replies, prayers and hugs. The radiologist said it would be tomorrow that I would hear, and I feel better than I did yesterday when I made that post. I cannot control what my body has done but I can control my attitude, and I have decided that no matter what the outcome I am not going to lie down and give up. I will post tomorrow when I hear.
Posts.Title: I am so scared Pocoglow debmc1958

Posts.Content: May 23, 2013 12:56PM Pocoglow wrote: I heard from my doctor today- the worst possible news. Cancer is invasive, and "poorly differentiated". All samples were cancerous. My doc is my ob-gyn- we have a 25 year relationship and she is terrific. I will have an appt with the breast surgeon, Dr Jodi Chambers (my doc's recommendation and I trust her) next Wednesday. Dr Panter, my ob-gyn, said the next step will probably be wholeÂ  body MRI. Dr Panter was calling from home - she will fax me the report tommorow. I am numb, I think. BTW, if there is anyone reading this in the Denver area I live in the foothills west of town- Morrison. Would appreciate any input. I will post more when I know more.
Posts.Title: I am so scared Pocoglow debmc1958

Posts.Content: Pocoglow wrote: I went in today for my annual mammogram, and the radiologist (he reads on site if you ask) did an ultrasound, and then a core biopsy on two suspicous areas (less than 1cm) amd a lymph node in the breast. I will get the results Thursday. I am so scared. Log in to post a reply
